detail.content: Accelerated Bachelor's-Master's Programs, College of Arts and Science | NYU                                                  Navigation       College of Arts and Science                 About Arts and Science | Departments and Programs | The Faculty       About the College | Programs | Students | Admissions | Alumni               Home > Academic Programs > B.A./M.A. Programs         Accelerated Bachelor's-Master's Programs       There are several ways that CAS students may begin earning credit   towards a Master's degree while still pursuing undergraduate studies.   Our accelerated, dual degree programs allow students to complete a   Master's in less time and at a lower cost than is normally required.   Students in these programs begin graduate coursework while still in CAS   and then apply that coursework towards designated Master's programs in   NYU's Graduate School of Arts and Science , Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public  Service , and Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development . Please   click on the links below to learn more about these unique time and   cost saving study options.  Before applying to one of the programs below, please meet with a Bachelor's-Master's advisor to discuss the application process and your academic plan:  Bachelor's-Master's Walk-In Advising Hours   Tuesdays, 12:00pm - 1:00pm Fridays, 11:00am - 12:00pm *NO HOURS FRI, MAY 1* with Scott Statland @ the Academic Resource Center (ARC) 18 Washington Place (check-in at front desk) ~ Mondays, 11:30am - 12:30pm Thursdays, 3:00pm - 4:00pm with Samantha Dillard @ the Preprofessional Advising Center Silver Center, 31 Washington Place, Room 901 (check-in at front desk) ~ or by appointment (click here to schedule)  Accelerated Bachelor's-Master's Program (CAS & GSAS)  Program Summary :   Students admitted to this program complete at least a quarter of required Master's degree credits while still undergraduates (these credits do not   count towards the Bachelor's degree). In the graduate portion of the   program, students receive a scholarship covering up to 50% of   tuition and registration fees for one year, during which time they can finish the remainder of   the Master's degree. SP15 Priority Application Deadline : March 2, 2015. Late applications are accepted on a rolling basis, though   not all departments can accept late applications. Please contact us to inquire further about your program of   interest. Questions? : Visit us during walk-in advising hours (schedule above) or write to cas-gsas-group@nyu.edu.      BA-MA and Accelerated MA Teacher Education Programs (CAS & Steinhardt)    Program Summary :     Students in selected CAS majors (Biology, Chemistry, English, History,   Mathematics, and Physics) can complete both their Bachelor's degree and a   Master's degree in Teaching (grades 7 - 12) in just 5 years. In   addition to saving money by completing the MA at an accelerated pace,   students in this dual degree program receive a generous scholarship   toward the MA degree. The scholarship typically covers 30% of graduation   tuition and may cover more depending on the program of study and   availability of external funds.       SP15 Pre-Application Deadline : We will accept pre-applications on a rolling basis following the March 17 priority deadline. Questions? : Visit us during walk-in advising hours (schedule above) or write to cas-steinhardt-group@nyu.edu.  Accelerated BA-MPA & BA-MUP Programs (CAS & Wagner) Program Summary :   Students pursue a Bachelor of Arts (BA) from the College   of Arts and Science and begin coursework towards a Master of Public Administration (MPA) or   Master of Urban Planning (MUP) from the Robert F. Wagner Graduate School   of Public Service. This program combines the benefits of a broad   liberal arts education at the undergraduate level with a professional   education at the graduate level. SP15 Pre-Application Deadline : We will accept pre-applications on a rolling basis following the March 17 priority deadline. Questions? : Visit us during walk-in advising hours (schedule above) or write to cas-wagner-group@nyu.edu.                     Welcome!
